intro: Persoonia iogyna, commonly known as the pink woolly everlasting, is a species of flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, woolly, pinkish-white inflorescences. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically arranged in dense, cylindrical clusters. Persoonia iogyna is well adapted to the arid and Mediterranean climates of its native region, with a deep root system that helps it survive in dry conditions. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
